page.title: 18TOURISM IN GREAT HAYWOOD
page.content: When we did our survey we questioned visitors about the area. The main attraction is Shugborough Hall and its gardens. Other people just pass through or visit relatives. We interviewed some people from London and they said that they liked the village and the area around it. For most of them it was their first time here, but they said they liked it and would come again. The canal brings tourists to the village. We also interviewed some Canadians on a canal holiday. They stayed two or three days and went sightseeing. Some people said they would like to live here but the others preferred their own community. If more people started visiting,the shops would get more money. The public house could offer accomodation.
